item.title: Denote Explore
item.description:
Denote Explore: Explore your digital Denote garden The Denote-Explore package provides auxiliary functions to maintain and explore your collection of Denote files. Denote-Explore provides three groups of Emacs commands:

  • Summary statistics: Count notes, attachments and keywords.
  • Random walks: Generate new ideas using serendipity.
  • Janitor: Manage your denote collection.
  • Visualisations: Visualise your Denote network.
pprevos/denote-explore

For us Denote users

item.title: 2024.01.21 - Journal (Sun)
item.description:
Low 0.8, High 22.7 - Freezing fog

I have an Espanso snippet (:weather) for the weather forecast, which means I put the forecast everywhere all the time. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯. Oh I forgot I have two snippets, there's also one for the current conditions (:wttr) ☁️ Overcast +16°F.

I want this place to be a messy soup of ideas, notes, conversations, links, quotes, etc. No rules. No audience (that I pay attention to, anyway). Then, if something worthwhile shows up, put it in the blog.

item.title: 2024.01.20 - Journal (Sat)
item.description:
These journal posts are turning into nothing more than something onto which to hang "also on..." links

I want this place to be my weird repository for anything and everything but where does that leave the blog? There are no rules here and I like that.

item.title: 2024.01.13 - Journal (Sat)
item.description:
There's so much of my stuff in here. The trick with TiddlyWiki is not overthinking it. There are so many cool things one can do with it that it's tempting to try them all. Note to self: Don't! Just add tiddlers and maybe link a few.

Having Sourcehut down for a few days makes one think about resilience and dependencies. I have a dozen or so private repos there but I'd been moving them to a self-hosted Gitea instance over the past month or so. I've been in an "own the entire stack" sort of mood. This will likely change back to the "let someone else handle it" mood before long. When it does, I'll be back at Sourcehut.

I almost forgot that I finagled TiddlyWiki to publish an RSS feed, but it only includes tiddlers tagged with so I'm tagging this one as a test. 👋

item.title: 2024.01.05 - Journal (Fri)
item.description:
Still here, wishing I'd use TiddlyWiki more often.

I just noticed that Baty.net's daily notes behave just like they do here on the wiki. Some stuff, then links to other things I wrote that day. Great, now I have two similar-but-different things. Like always.

item.title: Things in Doom that are broken by default
item.description:
I recently switched from my home-grown Emacs config back to [](#Doom%20Emacs). I started fresh, so ran into the same issues I'd solved previously. This time, I'm writing them down.

    1. Org-agenda doesn’t show today by default

I have to hit . every time.

    1. Line wrapping is weird in Org-journal

Wrapped lines are indented all goofily, so I add this:

Fix incorrect indenting in (esp. org-journal) buffers

(defun jab/disable-adaptive-wrap() (adaptive-wrap-prefix-mode -1)) (add-hook 'visual-line-mode-hook #'jab/disable-adaptive-wrap)

    1. Respect visual lines (evil) (doesn't)

[Wiki entry](https://wiki.baty.net/#Respecting%20visual%20lines%20in%20Doom%20Emacs%20evil-mode)

Short version: use (setq evil-respect-visual-line-mode t) in init.el because for some reason it doesn't "take" anywhere else.

    1. Invalid Base64 Data error

Attached PDFs cause a “Invalid Base64 data” error when opening an org buffer. It's annoying because then I don't get indentation, etc. The files aren't *missing*, either, they're just not images.

Had to add this:

Fix for "Invalid Base64" error
https://github.com/doomemacs/doomemacs/issues/3185

(defadvice! no-errors/+org-inline-image-data-fn (_protocol link _description) :override #'+org-inline-image-data-fn "Interpret LINK as base64-encoded image data. Ignore all errors." (ignore-errors (base64-decode-string link)))

item.title: TheLathe: 4 Apr 2022 (Monday)
item.description: I'm sorry, but I've been writing over at baty.net again.

item.title: TheLathe: 31 Mar 2022 (Thursday)
item.description:
☁️ Overcast +55°F

I made some prints from 4x5 negatives this morning using the big Beseler in a spare bedroom. It was cool that I could do it, but there's something wrong with the enlarger. The filter mechanism is janky and the "white light" indicator doesn't come on unless I do things in a certain order, and when the indicator is on, the lamp doesn't work.

I hate capitalism but I need money and I want things, so ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

item.title: TheLathe: 30 Mar 2022 (Wednesday)
item.description:
🌦 Light rain +33°F

Alice got me up at 3:00 am WHY ALICE!? :)

Please stop using Discord.

New Note: Saving a Maildir email as .eml using Mu4e

Why am I even here?

Can't wait for Mr. Robot season 15 to start

item.title: TheLathe: 29 Mar 2022 (Tuesday)
item.description:
Still using the new journal title even though I don't think I like it.

New note: Org mode custom link types

Canceled my MailBrew subscription. Don't need it. I happened to check on it the day before it was scheduled to renew for $99. Love when that happens, but they should always send a notice of renewal in advance.

Every email I send using Mu4e goes to spam. I have no idea why but I'm back to Mail.app because who needs that kind of grief.

I learned today that an app I built back in the early 2000s is still being used and the company still loves it. IIRC it was written in 4th Dimension. Wow.
